detaileddescription.para: Section: Visualization Toolkit Volume Rendering Classes

sect1.title: Usage
sect1.para: vtkVolumeRayCastMIPFunction is a volume ray cast function that computes the maximum value encountered along the ray. This is either the maximum scalar value, or the maximum opacity, as defined by the MaximizeMethod. The color and opacity returned by this function is based on the color, scalar opacity, and gradient opacity transfer functions defined in the vtkVolumeProperty of the vtkVolume.
To create an instance of class vtkVolumeRayCastMIPFunction, simply invoke its constructor as follows obj = vtkVolumeRayCastMIPFunction

sect1.title: Methods
sect1.para:
The class vtkVolumeRayCastMIPFunction has several methods that can be used. They are listed below. Note that the documentation is translated automatically from the VTK sources, and may not be completely intelligible. When in doubt, consult the VTK website. In the methods listed below, obj is an instance of the vtkVolumeRayCastMIPFunction class.
string = obj.GetClassName ()
int = obj.IsA (string name)
vtkVolumeRayCastMIPFunction = obj.NewInstance ()

float = obj.GetZeroOpacityThreshold (vtkVolume vol) - Get the scalar value below which all scalar values have zero opacity.
